block.p: Nicole Trabold, the daughter of Anita M. Trabold and Albert Trabold of Seaford, N.Y., was married yesterday to Dr. Thomas Scott Campbell, the son of Louise S. Campbell and Dr. John K. Campbell of High Point, N.C. The Rev. Dr. Robert A. Hill performed the ceremony at the Asbury First United Methodist Church in Rochester.

Mrs. Campbell, 28, is a social worker in obstetrics and gynecology at Strong Memorial Hospital in Rochester. She graduated from the State University at Buffalo and received a master's degree in social work from the University of Michigan. Her father, a retired electrical engineer, worked in Bethpage, N.Y., for Northrop-Grumman, the aerospace company and weapons maker. Her mother is a day care provider in Seaford.

Nicole Trabold, the daughter of Anita M. Trabold and Albert Trabold of Seaford, N.Y., was married yesterday to Dr. Thomas Scott Campbell, the son of Louise S. Campbell and Dr. John K. Campbell of High Point, N.C. The Rev. Dr. Robert A. Hill performed the ceremony at the Asbury First United Methodist Church in Rochester.

Mrs. Campbell, 28, is a social worker in obstetrics and gynecology at Strong Memorial Hospital in Rochester. She graduated from the State University at Buffalo and received a master's degree in social work from the University of Michigan. Her father, a retired electrical engineer, worked in Bethpage, N.Y., for Northrop-Grumman, the aerospace company and weapons maker. Her mother is a day care provider in Seaford.

Dr. Campbell, 31, is known as Scott. He is an internist and a partner in Pulsifer Medical Associates, a group practice in Brighton, N.Y. He is also a clinical instructor in medicine at the University of Rochester School of Medicine and Dentistry. He graduated from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and also received his medical degree there. His father, a retired dentist, practiced in High Point.
